modules.description: This module provides a key-value map structure for managing polymorphic data associated with IP address and port pairs, supporting operations like insertion, deletion, lookup, merging, and traversal. It includes higher-order functions for mapping, filtering, and folding, along with conversions between maps and sequences, enabling use cases such as DNS flow tracking, network state management, and processing of endpoint-specific data.

This module implements DNS client transport logic over MirageOS stacks, handling plaintext and TLS connections with configurable nameservers. It provides functions to create and manage DNS contexts, send and receive queries, and handle connection lifecycle operations. Concrete use cases include initiating DNS lookups over TCP/UDP, managing TLS-secured DNS transports, and handling concurrent DNS requests with timeout and error handling.

This module implements DNS flow handling over TCP and UDP transports, providing functions to convert between flow types, read and send DNS messages, and manage connections. It works with TCP flows, IP addresses, and Cstruct buffers to support concrete use cases like DNS query processing, response handling, and transport-level communication. The IPM submodule tracks DNS flow state keyed by IP and port pairs, enabling efficient lookup and management of endpoint-specific DNS transactions.

This module implements DNS client operations over MirageOS networking stacks, supporting DNS queries via UDP, TCP, and DNS-over-TLS. It provides functions to configure and manage DNS contexts, perform address lookups (IPv4, IPv6), query resource records, and handle raw DNS replies with support for timeouts, caching, and custom nameservers. Concrete use cases include secure DNS resolution in MirageOS unikernels, concurrent DNS request handling, and integration with network stacks for domain-to-IP lookups.

This module implements asynchronous DNS resolution and connection handling with support for IPv4 and IPv6. It provides functions to connect to hosts by domain name or IP address, with configurable timeouts and retries for resolution and connection phases. Concrete use cases include establishing network connections in MirageOS-based applications, such as HTTP clients or DNS resolvers, where reliable and timed connection attempts are required.

This module implements DNS resolution and server handling with support for query processing, zone transfers, and dynamic updates. It works with DNS packets, resource records, IP addresses, and MirageOS network flows to enable concrete use cases such as authoritative DNS serving, secure DNS resolution, and handling DNS-over-TCP/UDP transactions. Key operations include query resolution, TSIG-signed message validation, AXFR zone transfers, and dynamic DNS updates with configurable timeouts and caching.

This module implements DNS resolution and server handling with support for query processing, zone transfers, and dynamic updates. It works with DNS packets, resource records, IP addresses, and MirageOS network flows to enable concrete use cases such as authoritative DNS serving, secure DNS resolution, and handling DNS-over-TCP/UDP transactions. Key operations include query resolution, TSIG-signed message validation, AXFR zone transfers, and dynamic DNS updates with configurable timeouts and caching.
